intro: Dorstenia barnimiana var. tropaeolifolia, commonly known as the "Mexican morning glory," is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling those of the morning glory genus. The plant is native to Mexico and is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. It has hairy, fleshy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Dorstenia barnimiana var. tropaeolifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm, humid environments.
